article.name: Mimecast Integration with SecurityCoach
article.title: Mimecast Integration with SecurityCoach
article.body:
In this article, you will learn how to integrate Mimecast with SecurityCoach. Once you set up this integration, data provided by Mimecast will be available under the SecurityCoach tab of your KnowBe4 console. This data can be viewed in SecurityCoach reports and used to create detection rules for real-time coaching campaigns. For general information about SecurityCoach, see our SecurityCoach Product Manual.

Set Up the Integration in Mimecast

To set up the integration in Mimecast, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your Mimecast console.
  2. Select the Administration Console tile.
  3. From the drop-down menu on the left, navigate to Services > API and Platform Integrations.
  4. In the Available Integrations section, find the Mimecast API 2.0 tile and select Generate Keys.
  5. Read the terms and conditions and select Next at the bottom-right corner of the page. You’ll be taken to the Fill in your Application Details page.
  6. In the Application Name field, enter a name for this integration, such as “KnowBe4”.
  7. In the Category field, select Business Intelligence.
  8. In the Products field, select all of the following options:

    • Threats, Security Events, and Data for CG
    • Email Security Cloud Gateway
    • Threat Management
    • Audit Event
    • Security Events
    • Connector
  9. Then, click Apply at the bottom-right corner of the Products drop-down menu.
  10. In the Application Role field, select Basic Administrator.
  11. In the Description field, enter a description for this integration.
  12. Click Next at the bottom-right corner of the page.
  13. On the Notification Settings page, enter the name of a Technical Point of Contact and their Email.
  14. Click Next at the bottom-right corner of the page.
  15. On the Review your information page, click Add and Generate Keys.
  16. Copy the Client ID and Client Secret and save them to a secure place you can easily access.

Set Up the Integration in SecurityCoach

To set up the integration in your KSAT console, follow the steps below.

  1. Log in to your KSAT console and navigate to SecurityCoach > Setup > Security Vendor Integrations.
  2. Locate Mimecast and click Configure.
  3. Paste your Client ID and Client Secret that you copied earlier.
  4. Click Connect.
Note:Events from Mimecast are automatically mapped to users using their email address.

images.alt:
This image captures the "Summary" step (Step 4) of the "Add Mimecast API 2.0 Application" workflow, overlaid by a critical modal dialog displaying application credentials.

**1. Main Workflow Context (Background):**
*   **Header:** The page title is "Add Mimecast API 2.0 Application."
*   **Progress Indicator:** The vertical navigation indicates completion of the first three steps ("Disclaimer," "Details," "Notifications") and currently rests on "4 Summary."
*   **Review Pane:** The visible section is titled "Review your information." Details include "Application Name: KnowBe4 App" and "Category: Other."

**2. Modal Dialog (Foreground):**
The primary focus is the modal dialog box titled: **"Manage API 2.0 Credentials for 'KnowBe4 App'"**

*   **Security Warning:** Text reads: "Do not share application credentials."
*   **Critical Alert Banner (Yellow):** Contains an alert icon and the text: "Copy your client secret to a safe place. This is the only time the client secret will be displayed."
*   **Credential Display:** Two key-value pairs are listed, both initially masked:
    *   **Client Id:** Masked string.
    *   **Client Secret:** Masked string.
*   **Interactive Controls:** Both the Client Id and Client Secret rows feature two icons adjacent to the masked data:
    *   A **View icon** (eye symbol) to toggle visibility.
    *   A **Copy icon** (document symbol) to copy the credential to the clipboard.
*   **Action Button:** A single, blue primary button labeled **"Close."**
